title: Netflix warns that new services from Disney and Apple will hit growth
text:
Netflix has warned that new streaming services from Apple and Disney could squeeze its growth in the coming months as it gears up for its greatest competitive challenge to date.

The US internet video company signed up 6.8m new subscribers to its monthly service in the third quarter of the year, an improvement on the previous three months, when it recorded its slowest growth for three years and sent shares tumbling.

However, it said it expects growth in the fourth quarter to decline year-on-year as Apple and Disney enter the market, meaning that subscriber growth will decline in 2019 for the first time in recent years.

Both Apple and Disney are launching cheaper rivals to Netflix next month, in a major escalation of the video streaming wars.

“The launch of these new services will be noisy,” Netflix said in a letter to shareholders. “There may be some modest headwind to our near-term growth.”

However, it said it expects growth to improve after temporary disruption. “In the long-term, though, we expect we’ll continue to grow nicely given the strength of our service and the large market opportunity.

“In our view, the likely outcome from the launch of these new services will be to accelerate the shift from linear TV to on demand consumption of entertainment.”
description: Netflix has warned that new streaming services from Apple and Disney could squeeze its growth in the coming months as it gears up for its greatest competitive challenge to date.
